[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 26]
Reasoning: **Evaluating card hand strategies**

I'm in a situation where I only have one hand to score at least 800 chips. My current cards include a mix but no flush since I have three hearts, two clubs, and two spades. I can discard up to four before I play to improve. One notable option is a straight with 10, J, Q, K, A, giving me a solid chance to score significantly. The flush would be powerful, but it doesn't seem possible right now. I need to strategize carefully!
**Calculating chip values for cards**

I'm trying to calculate the total chips from my current cards. Initially, it seems like I’d have a base of 30 chips plus the values of each card, totaling 81 chips. However, without a flush, I miss out on triggering some bonus multipliers, leaving me with a total of 324 chips, which isn’t enough. I could also consider playing a pair of tens for a different score, but even that falls short. I really need to aim for a flush or straight flush with my discards to improve my hand!
**Calculating heart flush probability**

I’m looking to achieve a flush by obtaining 5 hearts in my hand of 8 cards. Right now, I’ve got 3 hearts, which means I need 2 more from the remaining cards. With 10 hearts left in a 44-card deck, I can use discards to improve my chances. I can keep my A♥, J♥, and 7♥, while discarding the other five cards. The expected outcome is around 1.136 hearts in 5 draws, making it a bit tricky but still possible!
**Calculating probabilities for flushes**

I'm estimating the probabilities of getting at least 2 hearts when drawing from my hand. If I calculate C(44,5) correctly, it gives about 1,086,008. For the scenario of no hearts, P0 is around 0.256. With C(10,1) and C(34,4), I find P1 is roughly 0.427. That means the probability of getting 2 hearts or more is about 31.7% after the first discard. If that doesn’t work out, I could also consider pursuing a diamond flush since I have options with discards!
**Determining flush strategies**

I'm considering a flush strategy since scoring all 5 cards activates multipliers and bonuses. A diamond flush could be great, but starting with no diamonds makes it challenging. The option of a hearts flush seems easier and can still yield high points. I have three hearts, so I'll aim to keep them and discard the rest, maximizing my chances of drawing more hearts. After calculating probabilities, it looks like going for hearts is the best option. I'll discard the other five cards now!

Command: discard 1 2 6 7 8

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
